overallSummary: Fabio Giglietto maintains an active presence on Mastodon, LinkedIn, and Bluesky, focusing on research related to social media, disinformation, and computational social science. His largest following is on LinkedIn, while his most recent activity is on Bluesky. He utilizes the platforms to disseminate research findings, announce opportunities, and engage in discussions.

contentThemes.description: Sharing research papers, project updates, and announcements of new findings.
Focusing on the use of computational methods for analyzing social media data.
Investigating and discussing coordinated inauthentic behavior and information operations on social media platforms.
Announcing job openings and research opportunities within the team.

recommendations: Diversify content formats (e.g., videos, infographics) to increase engagement.
Engage more actively in conversations by responding to comments and questions.
Tailor content to each platform's audience to maximize relevance and impact.
Use relevant hashtags consistently to improve content discoverability.
Run A/B tests on post timing and content to optimize performance.

platformInsights.bluesky: Bluesky shows a strong interest in research publications and opportunities, indicated by high repost rates. Focus on sharing visually appealing snippets of research and actively engage in discussions related to computational social science.
platformInsights.mastodon: Mastodon content receives moderate engagement, suggesting a niche audience. Continue sharing updates on CooRnet and engaging in discussions related to methodological approaches to studying disinformation, but explore interactive content formats like polls.
platformInsights.linkedin: LinkedIn sees the highest engagement, driven by announcements of grants and hiring opportunities. Continue to post professional updates, thought leadership pieces, and job postings related to social media analysis. Consider sharing longer-form articles to showcase expertise.
